name: French Farmhouse Garlic Chicken
ingredients: 4 small skinless, boneless chicken breast halves 1 tbsp lemon juice
1 tbsp cooking oil 4 tsp all-­‐purpose flour
40 (15) cloves of unpeeled garlic* 2 tbsp dry white wine or chicken broth
steps: ¼ tsp salt 1 tsp dried basil, crushed
¼ tsp pepper ½ tsp dried oregano, crushed
½ cup dry white wine or chicken broth hot mashed potatoes or cooked rice
½ cup chicken broth cooked zucchini, sliced
*Halve any large garlic cloves. If time allows, peel the garlic before cooking; otherwise, as you eat the cooked
cloves, simply slip the skins off them with the tip of your dinner knife.
Rinse chicken; pat dry. Season with the salt and pepper. In a 10-­‐inch skillet heat oil over medium-­‐high heat.
Add chicken and garlic cloves. Cook chicken for 2 to 3 minutes on each side or just till brown, turning once.
Slowly add ½ cup broth, lemon juice, basil, and oregano. Simmer, covered for 6 to 8 minutes or till chicken is
tender and no longer pink. Use a slotted spoon to transfer the chicken and garlic to a warm serving platter;
keep warm. In a small bowl stir together flour and the 2 tbsp dry white wine or broth. Stir in the pan juices.
Bring to boiling. Cook and stir for one minute more. Spoon sauce atop chicken. Serve with potatoes or rice
and, if desired, zucchini. Serves four.
